car1.name: Nissan Skyline 2020
car1.description: Aside from ProPilot 2.0, another highlight is the new engine and power options. The base engine is a 3.0-liter twin-turbo V6 making 304 PS. For those who prefer a greener engine, there's also a hybrid which uses the same 3.0-liter engine, albeit naturally aspirated, and is paired with an electric motor. Combined output for the Skyline Hybrid is rated at 306 PS. Last but not least is the 400R, a tribute to the R33 400R from the 90's. Again, it uses the same twin-turbo V6 engine as the base model, but it's been heavily upgraded to put out 405 PS. Think of it then as a junior GT-R with four doors.

0c9c9b40-d259.name: Hyundai i30 2020
0c9c9b40-d259.description: The i30 is a front-wheel drive 4 door with 5 seats, powered by a 2.0L INLINE 4 engine that has 120 kW of power (at 6200 rpm) and 203 Nm of torque (at 4700 rpm) via a Six-speed Manual. HYUNDAI claims the i30 ACTIVE uses 7.3L/100km of Unleaded Petrol in the combined city and highway cycle while putting out 170g of CO2. It has a 50L fuel tank, meaning it should be able to travel 685km per full tank.

6e029932-b40a.name: Honda Civik 2020
6e029932-b40a.description: Consistently one of the best-selling compact cars, the Honda Civic earns its accolades by featuring a fun and engaging driving experience, impressive fuel economy, and superb interior packaging with room for five passengers. Last redesigned in 2016, the Civic is still a standout in its class, with subtle feature and styling enhancements for 2020.
